description: Can't even log in, neither by username nor mail.
its okay,working nicely

The only thing is that it is very rudimentary; it lacks a lot of features and it surely could use a couple more features. Other than that, I think it's a great alternative to the official Spotify client, as it is very lightweight.
And also for the "In Rainbows" album by Radiohead hahah
An excellent alternative to the default spotify. Lightweight and simple!
just empty library and playlists...
Very lightweight program, it works really well. One of the best alternatives to the flatpak and snapd packages.

Why would we need an open source app for a proprietary software that uses the proprietary services and delivers a scraped experience compared to the official app?

Not trashing the developers, just the idea and the app itself. Seems pointless and the app is missing a lot of key features.
Much faster than Spotify's app and uses way less resources. Love it!
its written in rust, avoid at any cost
doesnt work. Can't login.
dosen't even work

The ui needs some cleanup and there are some missing features although you can arguably skip friend integration for simplicities sake.
grear

The app runs fast, it loads all my playlists, and it actually fits my theme. There are some issues though. I can't shuffle my playlists, repeat my playlists and, downloading songs for offline doesn't exist yet, but I cant imagine that being impossible, what I can imagine being impossible is being able to use it without premium and modifying playlists. Sadly the spotify api doesn't expose the functionality to do these actions so either the developers need to come up with a clever way to circumvent this or we just get stuck witht this because there isn't really a way to fix this. This gets a 5 star rating from me because it does all it can with the limitations. Also please stop bashing this for not being able to use it with non-premium accounts, and not being able to modify playlists, they can't fix that.
summary: It's amazing but with shortcommings that probably can't be fixed

description: It can't seem to save my password for some reason. I installed all libcanberra-gtk packages and it doesn't seem to work. If this issue is fixed I'll give it a 5 star rating.
summary: Have to login every time I launch

description: hell of a good time spotify
A lot better than the RAM-Hungry and unstable alternative. Looks nice. I bet it will soon be just perfect.
I really like the app and its way snappier than the "official" App. The only thing I'm missing is a volume slider. I saw it in some Screenshots, but I cant find it in my App.
summary: Great App with a lot of potentianl

description: Needs very few permissions, that's great!
No bells, no whistles, very light. Just music. I love it!
I don't recommend it. It is in alpha quality, many of the features are not available.
summary: Where are the discover feed and podcasts??

description: Works as expected while looking consistent with Gnome's design language.
No complaints so far :-). Its fast and it plays my music.
( ALTHOUGH ( THE INTERFACE OF THIS SOFTWARE ) THAT IS GRAPHICAL IS VISUALLY CONSISTENT WITH MOST SOFTWARE THAT USES GTK , THE SOFTWARE DOES NOT CONTAIN MUCH FUNCTIONALITY )
summary: ( VISUALLY PLEASANT BUT DEVOID OF MUCH FUNCTIONALITY )

description: I have my spotify account created with facebook. Please provide a way to login using web based login.
This app needs more options for use of spotify like the viewing of profiles and individual songs. the ability to create playlists is for some reason absent?
HW 5STAR SUITe
summary: Smart And Shiny Are The BEST

description: Need a Spotify Premium account to log in and use this app. Currently, It only functions as a Spotify premium music list that you have downloaded from spotify.
Just what I want and need. Beautiful and super fast!
summary: Just what I want and need. Beautiful and super fast!

description: muito bom continuem...
On my system spotify takes a good 30 seconds to launch, but this takes the normal 1 second on my system. simplistic, but it is missing a lot of the functions normal spotify has
I think it really highlights what a great unified gnome desktop and mobile experience c̶o̶u̶l̶d̶ will look like.
summary: This really good for such a young app

description: Thanks for openning first-class Spotify experience for Phosh users!
I love that Spot is a native GTK app. It feels more at home in the Gnome desktop than the native Spotify client. It is still missing a few features, but it is completely functional.
Great improvement since the last time I checked the project
summary: Great improvement since the last time I checked the project

description: It should be noted in the description that this ONLY works with a Spotify PREMIUM account login.

the "offical" spotify is to cluttered for my taste
Spot is just beautiful
albums /playlists
no extra stuff
instant music
summary: Amazing app, straight to the point

description: can't scroll through followed artists.
This is excellent. Simple. Snappy. Slick.
It's have a much better experience than the Spotify App.

Great application, still incomplete but I hope the developing will lead to a more complete version!

PS: add the "go to song radio" function please, lol
I like how it match the whole system but i tried to change user and i can't logging again. where the setting are placed?
Although it has simple functionality for now, its key features such as fast and lightweight design make it an awesome client

The app looks great, runs really fast, and sticks to being what it is. 

There is no discovery, or recommended, or radio on here. It only shows your playlists (does not show "Liked" playlist). My "Library" was empty. If it gets the discovery part I'll switch to it full time. I have no playlists created so I will be sticking with the Spotify version for now.
I love this app, Spotify version can't play in background

I find the official Spotify UI quite bloated and cluttered. This UI is very clean and has everything I usually need as I mainly just play one of my playlists. It is fast and has a low memory footprint so I'm sold!
Great and easy to use app! Thanks!
Smooth, quick loading app. Need Premium.

I love the simplicity, and lightweight. It supports Gnome perfectly. 

Now if you can add Podcast support, that would be wonderful.
it works from the sounds of it, but not usable for a lot of people.
would be great if i can like tracks and add to playlist from this app
Just senseless.
summary: It works only with premium subscription

description: Lacks font hinting and can't seem to search for music I not in my library.
the refresh cache button doesnt work and there fore made the app unusable
Happy to have a GTK Spotify client
It's missing some of the options of the official app though...

The sofware is very nice, well polished and fast. However, some features you expect as clicking in the artist's name to go to their homepage and other smaller features are missing. This is not so bad after you learn to navigate. It works simple.

Since the 07/01/22 update this app has lost most of the main features of Spotify. It now only shows tiles for songs saved in My Library and for saved playlists. Cannot now access the main library of songs nor features like Discover Weekly, Friday Release, Daily Mix, etc. Sadly,the app has regressed not progressed as might have been expected after an update.
summary: Main features lost following latest update

description: Fantastic, if a little simple. Wish it had a few more options (e.g., hide or place playlists in folders, select bitrate, etc.), but am overall really happy there's a native GTK option for Spotify

Spot is a nice Spotify client if you want to listen to music only. As of now it is not possible to listen to podcast.

It integrates very well with your Gnome desktop environment and is much faster than the client from Spotify itself.
summary: Nice client if you want to listen to music

description: I am surprised , how well this works so far for basic spotify usage - listen to your library and search.
Works well on mobile and desktop. Not great for finding new music but a good way to listen to Spotify with a native client.
summary: Works well, great simple and native alternative to spotify

description: I love this! I've allways wanted a good looking native spotify app.
summary: it looks beautiful and works well!

description: the orig client is bloated but this one is great. A separate volume mixer would be great tho

That said, there are a few things I'm personally missing 
- a right-click context menu would be nice
- Better ways to reorder playlists, like folders
- Ability to like songs and add them to playlists (I can understand this may not be possible with the spotify API however)

Good alternative regardless though!
summary: Nice UI, and way less bloat

description:
In Spotify client you should be able see the recommendations to play right, now. If you make an internal one that would be cool. Also what about caching/downloading? or is this not classed as "good enough" to also cache music for Spotify? My computer has TPM, and as long as a user has a computer with TPM Spotify should be able to be happy with that?

Love the Light Mode, I'm sort of the kind of guy who likes my theme to match the time of day (or environment) so I should have at least a dark and light mode option.

Discrete buttons? Getting to the album/artist requires more clicks than necessary can't you allow buttons appear on artist and album names? With the three dot button why not allow right clicking open the same menu? 

Album art a little small? can you add a feature to "full screen" to current playing? Maybe add a little audio vis nothing like windows media player but a little animation that appears below or beside the album art. spotify allows larger album art pictures.

Modifying preferences stops playback ?️

I can use Spot while "closed" Yes! Spotify client annoyed me a lot on this point but also Spot can resize much better to small sizes so I kind of don't mind leaving it open. Please access the hotbar/topbar so we can access more features by clicking the widget and getting a drop down, appearing when you "close" the application and then "exiting" the application from that menu?
summary: Where is the "recommendation" panel? I have a lot to say

description: I love how clean it looks and how little space it takes up and throw in the fact that it works flawlessly on my laptop (Fedora 36). I strongly recommend over the bloated spotify app.

Love that this app is written in gtk4 and utilizes libadwaita, however one small problem is the icon themes.... somehow a few icons are missing but i resolved it by usning a 3rd party icon set. Great job otherwise!! keep it up!
summary: Love it, Highly recomend to anybody using spotify on gnome 42+

description: You shou've written this in the description of the store, not in the github page.
Finally, a Spotify client that runs in the background. I wish there were a tray icon, but it's perfect. I liked the interface better than the official client, cleaner.
summary: Clean interface and can run in the background

description:
Keeps logging me out. Will not let me select music, just bugs out.
The app crashes and won't me access playlists from the front page.

This simply does not work.

This has almost everything I want from it, and nothing else. Love having a music streamer that actually integrates with my system. The lack of playlist management doesn't bother me, I just use my phone for that instead. The only thing I'd like is a little more stability, and the ability to just tap a button to shuffle and play the playlist I'm in.

First impression: not bad. Displays my personal stuff from Spotify. I agree that a nice future feature would be something like getting the daily mixes or recommendations and similar. But this is a good start.
Absolutely ridiculous that you have to have a premium account.
summary: Why do you need a premium account?!

description: Ich nutze Spot auf dem pinephone und auf dem Desktop zu meiner Zufriedenheit.
summary: minimalistisch und tut was es soll

description: Auch wenn ich immernoch keinen Ton hören kann, liebe ich einfach das Design! Es sieht alles so wunderschön aus, ich weis gar nicht wo hingucken. Unbedingt Downloaden! Ich liebe dieses GUI!

The app actually sounds far better than native spotify on ubuntu, slight problem: Almost all functions and settings are just gone on this app, so as long as you don't mind that you cannot add stuff to playlists and so on it's fine.
You are only able to listen to what you prepared before and search for stuff...
And by the way spotify doesn't realize that you're using this account to listen online already xD
It is very nice and works on my pinephone but on both do i need to login in every app launch
opppppppppppppppppppppppppppp
ayuda como funciona
El cliente requiere que tengas una cuenta de Spotify Premium para entrar, cuando en la oficial no requieres de eso.
Still trying to figure out how to shuffle songs
se puede descargar el spotify desde la web no veo por que instalar este

The official application is able to be installaed and works well, hope this project could overpass it. The integration with the system as an audio player to be able to use multimedia keys or keyboard shotcuts to control the app.

Permite escuchar música de Spotify usando solo tu cuenta Premium. Es muy minimalista por diseño y porque posee solo las opciones básicas. Ventaja frente a la oficial: Ser una app nativa, que consume mucho menos ram. Versión Flatpak (Flathub).

Aplicacion nativa y disponible en Flathub, con un enfoque minimalista. Esta bien integrada con las directivas de gnome.
El unico inconveniente que pude encontrar, es que cada vez que inicio sesion, me envia un correo de notificacion de un nuevo acceso a mi cuenta, como si no se guardara el dispositivo en el que estoy ingresando.
En cuanto a recursos del sistema esta Spot (version Flatpak), presenta menos consumo de ram que la aplicacion "Spotify" disponible tambien en Flathub.
Certes c'est moins fourni que l'application officielle de Spotify, mais il est carrément plus léger - et il y a ce dont on a besoin: recherche, playlist, écoute, pochette, voilà.
Fonctionne mais très basic
Не запускается!
Прям бесило что в официальном клиенте справа есть поле фейсбука. Ну нет у меня аккаунта в этом всратом фейсбуке. А Спот очень хорошо работает и ничего лишнего
Не удалось оценить приложения. Логин только по email + pass. Это означает, что нет возможности попробовать приложение, если ты используешь для логина соц сеть.
summary: Нет авторизации с помощью Google и FB

description: I can't get access to my music without playlists
У меня учетка по Apple Id , ввожу мыло и пароль и не могу войти в учетку!
У меня учётная запись зарегистрированнна через Google, а в этом приложении нет такого способа аторизации, и приходится регистрировать новую учётку.
